thread.title: Jesy Nelson can't wait to see 'new man' Chris Clark as she shares sultry selfie
thread.title_full: Jesy Nelson can't wait to see 'new man' Chris Clark as she shares sultry selfie

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Jesy Nelson can't wait to see 'new man' Chris Clark as she shares sultry selfie
text:
Jesy Nelson can't wait to see 'new man' Chris Clark as she shares sultry selfie The redheaded Little Mix star couldn't contain her excitement Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jesy Nelson has been heavily linked to TOWIE's Chris Clark - and it appears she can't wait to be back with her rumoured new man. 
The Little Mix singer and the reality star have been rumoured to have sparked a romance since the start of the year , and they continued to fuel the speculation on social media. 
On Wednesday, Jesy dropped another hint with a cryptic Instagram snap, in which hinting at her excitement over being reunited with her possible new man. 
"Only One More Sleep (sic)," it read. Read More 
With various loved-up emojis including a heart and heart eyes, she wrote a jumbled caption of random letters to show she can barely contain her excitement. Jesy shared this smoldering selfie (Photo: jesynelson/Instagram) 
She's currently in the US with her bandmates, and the Shout Out To My Ex singer couldn't resist a selfie on the road as they support Ariana Grande. Read More 
The star smoldered in the snap, showing off her cleavage in a low cut top, with her wavy red locks falling down - and she completed the look with stunning eyeshadow and a simple black choker. Jesy and Chris have fueled the speculation in recent weeks (Photo: Instagram/ @chrisjclark_) 
Meanwhile, fans of the band were concerned about a possible rift in the band after Perrie Edwards cropped Jesy out of a series of Instagram photos . 
However, rumours they have fallen out have been rubbished by the group's rep, and the girls are still going strong with no plans to break up. 
"This is absolutely nonsense created out of nothing. There is no fallout whatsoever within Little Mix," a spokesman for the band told the Daily Star in response to the speculation Like us on Facebook
